definition: lit. to drive a lightweight chariot on a familiar road (idiom)/fig. to do sth routinely and with ease/a walk in the park
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: Scherdel said the first flight was a familiarization flight for he and the team.
sentences.chinese: 谢尔德说这次首航对他和队友们来说是轻车熟路。

sentences.english: He knows his way in the dark.
The waitress passes a fine menu to Molly who orders dishes adroitly.
sentences.chinese: 女服务生捧来菜单递给茉莉，后者轻车熟路地点菜。

sentences.english: 2， After a week, you'll be running around here like a pro.
sentences.chinese: 一星期之后你就会轻车熟路了。

sentences.english: The college football player knew his way around the locker room better than he did the library.
sentences.chinese: 大学足球选手对更衣储藏比图书馆更轻车熟路。

definition: lit. an easy drive on a familiar path (idiom); fig. experience makes progress easy/a task that is so familiar one can do it with one's hand tied behind one's back
lit. what the heart wishes, the hand accomplishes (idiom) skilled at the job/entirely in one's element/going smoothly and easily
a small appetizer/a piece of cake; very easy (idiom)
experienced person/an old hand at sth
to know sth like the back of one's hand (idiom)/to know (a person, a place etc) inside out
variant of 了如指掌[liao3 ru2 zhi3 zhang3]

pinyin: shen2 bu4 zhi1 gui3 bu4 jue2

definition: stretch a hand and grab it (idiom); very easy
